title: Khabib Nurmagomedov ready to overlook rematch with McGregor in favour of bout with Tony Ferguson
text:
Conor McGregor's hopes of securing a lucrative rematch with Khabib Nurmagomedov have been dashed after the Dagestan fighter targeted Tony Ferguson.

McGregor has not fought since losing by submission to lightweight champion Nurmagomedov in Las Vegas.

The pair came to blows outside of the cage in the moments after the fight which sparked a brawl in the crowd, leading to punishments for both fighters.

Khabib Nurmagomedov has put doubt on talk of a rematch with bitter rival Conor McGregor

Tony Ferguson is the fighter that Nurmagomedov is targeting next, rather than McGregor

McGregor has slipped down UFC's pound-for-pound rankings and a return to the cage appears more likely against Justin Gaethje or Dustin Poirier - the latter vocal in his desire to fight the Dublin star.

Nurmagomedov is still not ready to 'shake hands' with McGregor following the nasty end to their Las Vegas meeting and he is now focusing on securing a date with Ferguson, rather than entertaining the Irishman's call for a rematch.

'From a fighter's point of view, (the McGregor rivalry) is a thing of the past,' Nurmagomedov said in quotes reported by MMA Junkie. 'I have nothing to prove. But he has something to prove. We know he does.

Nurmagomedov is 'not ready to shake hands' with McGregor and is not focused on a rematch

'There's a lot of businessmen here and I think most of them will tell me to fight him because it'll bring money. I'd fight all the main contenders first, and I could fight him to benefit my agricultural projects.

'I have to say that Tony Ferguson deserves it more. You have to give him credit. He is on a 12-fight win streak and he deserves it more than Conor.'

Poirier has stoked up interest that he could be the man to fight McGregor on his return to the ring following the pair's online spat last week.

McGregor and Poirier originally met in UFC 178 in Las Vegas more than five years ago, when McGregor took less than two minutes to end his opponent's night.

Earlier in the week, Poirier tweeted that he had 'no clue' who he would fight next, before retweeting a fan who said: 'Stop lying, you're fighting Conor in Dublin.'
description: Conor McGregor's hopes of securing a lucrative rematch with Khabib Nurmagomedov look to have have been dashed after the Dagestan fighter confirmed he is targeting Tony Ferguson.
